oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Baseball team, 1928
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 1928 Middle Tennessee State Teachers College Baseball Team

The institution had its first full-time baseball coach in 1971; prior to that, coaching baseball was a part-time responsibility for assistant basketball coaches. The addition of field lighting in 1981 allowed MTSU to host night games and improve recruiting.

1st row (left to right): Frank Faulkinberry, Coach; Roy Bass, Outfield; Ralph Askins, Shortstop; Charley Yeargin, Outfield and Infield; Tom Thompson, Outfield and Infield; John Bass, 1st Base; Jesse Gregory, Catcher; and Noah Turpin, Outfield and Infield. 2nd row: Seth Springer, Outfield; Howard Coleman, 3rd Base; Ramon McCrory, Catcher; Kurfees Pullias, Outfield; Hilliard Phillips, Pitcher; Hubert Swann, Pitcher; Pete Howser, Pitcher; and Price Womack, Outfield.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Baseball players; Baseball teams; College sports; Middle Tennessee State Teachers College
